newsitem.title: UK: Bets put on Portillo as Tory leader after MP death.
newsitem.headline: Bets put on Portillo as Tory leader after MP death.

text.p: A British bookmaker said several people had already placed bets on former defence minister Michael Portillo becoming the next Conservative leader, after one of the party's members of parliament died.

William Hill said other possible leadership candidates tipped to stand in Sir Michael Shersby's seat included Hong Kong Governor Chris Patten and former Foreign Secretary Malcolm Rifkind, who like Portillo lost his seat in last week's election.

A spokesman said Portillo and Patten were quoted at 20-1 to become next Conservative leader, with Rifkind at 33-1. Former Welsh secretary William Hague is evens favourite to take over the job from John Major.

"Obviously the sad death of Michael Shersby opens the way for a high profile candidate to contest the forthcoming by-election with the possibility he could win the seat and contest the leadership election," the spokesman said.
Shersby, Conservative member of parliament for Uxbridge, had a majority of just 724.
